Class ArraySum

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, ptolemy.actor.Actor, ptolemy.actor.Executable, ptolemy.actor.FiringsRecordable, ptolemy.actor.Initializable, ptolemy.actor.TypedActor, ptolemy.kernel.util.Changeable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Debuggable, ptolemy.kernel.util.DebugListener, ptolemy.kernel.util.Derivable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Instantiable, ptolemy.kernel.util.ModelErrorHandler, ptolemy.kernel.util.MoMLExportable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Moveable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Nameable
public class ArraySum
extends Transformer
Compute the sum of the elements in an array. This actor reads an array from the input port and sends the sum of its elements to the output port. The output data type is at least the type of the elements of the input array. The elements of the input array have to support addition, or an exception will be thrown in the fire() method. This actor is similar to ArrayAverage, except that it supports data types that do not support division by an integer.
Since:
Ptolemy II 6.1
Version:
$Id: ArraySum.java 57040 2010-01-27 20:52:32Z cxh $
Author:
Edward A. Lee, Christine Avanessians
See Also:
ArrayAverage, Serialized Form

    • fire

      public void fire() throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
      Consume at most one array from the input port and produce the average of its elements on the output port. If there is no token on the input, or if the input array is empty, then no output is produced.
      Specified by:
      fire in interface ptolemy.actor.Executable
      Overrides:

      Throws:
      ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - If there is no director.
